summary: Alan G. Sentinella testified before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) on May 21, 1975, regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. His testimony covered his involvement in these investigations, focusing on telephone surveillance, alleged communist connections, and the FBI's operational policies. The documents consist of his testimony and recollections of his testimony before the SSC.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Alan G. Sentinella's significance lies in his involvement in investigations related to Martin Luther King Jr., the SCLC, and Stanley Levison, rather than direct involvement in the JFK assassination. His testimony provides insight into the FBI's operational policies and surveillance activities during that era.
